job_history.work_description: Manage forecasting, outlook, reporting and sales compensation process for Structured Product Services Group of Corporate Trust. Asset classes supported includes residential and commercial mortgage products as well as auto, student loans, life insurance and other asset classes. Identify and support process improvements to streamline reporting, simplify and improve forecast models and enhance metrics for productivity to support strategic business decisions. Develop pricing, cost and allocation models for existing products and new business opportunities providing financial data for strategic growth initiatives and pricing modifications. Support business objectives related to expense reduction goals. Manage team of 6-7 Consultants including staff that is located remotely with significant focus on skill development.

Managed team responsible for the weekly 90 day cash forecasting process during time of significant market/liquidity stress. Responsibilities included setting calendar, producing executive and summary reports with commentary, actual to forecast variance and model maintenance. Recommended adjustments to 90 day cash forecast along with risks and opportunities to cash needs. Completed ad hoc reporting requests for Treasury and Senior Management. Coordinated review of balance sheet forecast.

Completed monthly and quarterly forecasts and annual operating plan and reporting for the $45 billion residential mortgage financing portfolio. Coordinated pre-close and close process for portfolio. Developed portfolio and deal level yield analytics including net interest margin, provision expense and operating expense as well as rate/volume attribution for forecast and actuals for residential mortgage portfolio. Created and/or enhanced management reporting package of forecast and actual business results. Communicated forecast and actual results to both Finance and Business Management. Led project to develop and implement a new Essbase forecast model for the residential securitization portfolio accounted for as a financing accounting transaction. Implemented additional forecast process controls to improve accuracy and enhance coordination various groups.

Tracked indicative pricing and secondary fixed rate spread levels for Corporate debt issuance and peer group. Analyzed maturity risk, basis risk and repricing characteristics of debt portfolio. Analyzed consolidated liquidity and balance sheet trends for funding purposes.

Directed early estimate, month-end close, variance analysis, budgeting and forecasting processes. Developed and implemented new internal expense allocation methodology. Managed Analysts that supported the Employee Benefits Support Group. Integrated the daily finance support of Institutional Trust acquisitions.

Directed final finance integration of 22 Employee Benefit offices/states. Identified issues, implemented policy changes and conducted training for the general ledger conversion. Led department automation project for financial reporting and development of budget model. Implemented new Trust Operations cost allocation methodology and actual versus plan volume tracking. Led financial tracking for the merger of Norwest/Wells Fargo Trust Operations Groups. Identified and implemented changes to allocation model for un-invested cash balances. Managed analysts that provided daily finance support.

education.university: Carlson School of Management, University of Minnesota

skills.name: Financial Forecasting
skills.explanation: Has extensive experience in managing forecasting, outlook, and reporting processes, and has developed pricing, cost, and allocation models for various products, indicating expert-level mastery.

skills.name: Financial Analysis
skills.explanation: Has consistently demonstrated strong analytical skills in identifying process improvements, developing forecast models, and analyzing financial data to support strategic business decisions, indicating expert-level mastery.

skills.name: Financial Modeling
skills.explanation: Has developed and implemented various financial models, including pricing, cost, and allocation models, and has maintained and enhanced forecast models, indicating expert-level mastery.

skills.name: Leadership
skills.explanation: Has managed teams of various sizes, including remote teams, and has focused on skill development, indicating expert-level leadership skills.

skills.name: Financial Planning
skills.explanation: Has managed the development of annual operating plans and has coordinated the review of balance sheet forecasts, indicating expert-level mastery of financial planning.

skills.name: Financial Reporting
skills.explanation: Has produced executive and summary reports with commentary, and has completed ad hoc reporting requests for Treasury and Senior Management, indicating expert-level mastery of financial reporting.

skills.name: Risk Management
skills.explanation: Has analyzed maturity risk, basis risk, and repricing characteristics of debt portfolios, and has identified and implemented changes to allocation models for un-invested cash balances, indicating strong proficiency in risk management.

skills.name: Budgeting
skills.explanation: Has managed budgeting processes, including developing and implementing new internal expense allocation methodologies, indicating strong proficiency in budgeting.

skills.name: Financial Management
skills.explanation: Has directed early estimate, month-end close, variance analysis, budgeting, and forecasting processes, and has managed teams that supported various finance functions, indicating expert-level mastery of financial management.

skills.name: Accounting
skills.explanation: Has a Bachelor's degree in Accounting and has worked in various finance roles, indicating strong proficiency in accounting principles and practices.
